title: type
description: Contains information about an attribute field.

domains.description: A comma-delimited series of domain objects for each domain in the type.

id.description: A unique string or numerical ID for the type.

name.description: A user-friendly name for the type.

templates.description: Defined as a property of the layer definition when there are no types defined; otherwise, templates are defined as properties of the types.

domain_schema.json.title: domain
domain_schema.json.description: Domains specify the set of valid values for a field. The links below are the available domains.

codedValue_domain_schema.json.title: codedValue
codedValue_domain_schema.json.description: The coded value domain includes both the actual value that is stored in a database and a description of what the code value means.

codedValues.description: A set of valid values with unique names.

type.description: String value representing the domain type.

codedValue_schema.json.title: codedValue
codedValue_schema.json.description: A set of valid coded values with unique names.

code.description: String value indicating which unqiue code is used to identify the feature attribute.

name.description: A string value given for the coded domain.

inherited_domain_schema.json.title: inheritedDomain
inherited_domain_schema.json.description: This domain applies to domains on subtypes. It implies that the domain for a field at the subtype level is the same as the domain for the field at the layer level.

type.description: String value representing the domain type.

range_domain_schema.json.title: rangeDomain
range_domain_schema.json.description: Range domain specifies a range of valid values for a field

range.description: The first element is the minValue and the second element is the maxValue.

type.description: String value representing the domain type.

template_schema.json.title: template
template_schema.json.description: Templates describe features that can be created in a layer. They are generally used with feature collections and editable web-based CSV layers. Templates are not used with ArcGIS feature services as these already have templates defined in the service. They are also defined as properties of the layer definition when there are no defined types. Otherwise, templates are defined as properties of the types.

description.description: A string value containing a detailed description of the template.

drawingTool.description: An optional string that can define a client-side drawing tool to be used with this feature.

name.description: A string containing a user-friendly name for the template.

prototype.description: A feature object representing a prototypical feature for the template.

esriDocumentation.additionalInformation: drawingTool strings: esriFeatureEditToolPolygon, esriFeatureEditToolTriangle, esriFeatureEditToolRectangle, esriFeatureEditToolLeftArrow, esriFeatureEditToolRightArrow, esriFeatureEditToolEllipse, esriFeatureEditToolUpArrow, esriFeatureEditToolDownArrow, esriFeatureEditToolCircle, esriFeatureEditToolFreehand, esriFeatureEditToolLine, esriFeatureEditToolText, esriFeatureEditToolPoint

feature_schema.json.title: feature
feature_schema.json.description: Contains information about an attribute field and feature geometry.

attributes.description: The feature attributes. A JSON object that contains a dictionary of name-value pairs. The names are the feature field names. The values are the field values, and they can be any of the standard JSON types: string, number, and boolean. Note that date values are encoded as numbers. The number represents the number of milliseconds since epoch (January 1, 1970) in UTC.

geometry.description: It can be any of the supported geometry types.

symbol.description: Symbol used for drawing the feature.

geometry_schema.json.title: geometry
geometry_schema.json.description: Please refer to the links below for objects which define the JSON formats of geometry and spatial reference objects.

multipoint_geometry_schema.json.title: multipointGeometry
multipoint_geometry_schema.json.description: Contains an array of points, along with a spatial reference field.

hasM.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains M coordinate values.

hasZ.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains Z coordinate values.

points.description: An array that corresponds to 2D and 3D points.

spatialReference.description: The spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT).

spatialReference_schema.json.title: spatialReference
spatialReference_schema.json.description:
The spatialReference object is located at the top level of the JSON hierarchy. In addition to this, it is also available within the operationalLayer and basemap objects.

Many predefined spatial references have already been defined and are available for use. A spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT). The default tolerance and resolution values for the associated coordinate system are used.

A spatial reference can optionally include a definition for a vertical coordinate system (VCS), which is used to interpret the z values of a geometry.

latestVcsWkid.description: (Optional) The current wkid value of the vertical coordinate system.

latestWkid.description: (Optional) Identifies the current wkid value associated with the same spatial reference. For example a WKID of '102100' (Web Mercator) has a latestWKid of '3857'.

vcsWkid.description: (Optional) The wkid value of the vertical coordinate system.

wkid.description: The well-known ID (WKID) of the coordinate system. Specify either WKID or the well-known text (WKT) of the coordinate system.

wkt.description: The well-known text (WKT) of the coordinate system. Specify either WKT or WKID of the coordinate system.

esriDocumentation.additionalInformation:
All operational layers in the scene are drawn or requested in the spatial reference of the basemap layers.

The **basemap** defines the spatial reference and tiling scheme of the scene. Each **baseMapLayer** must be in the same spatial reference and tiling scheme.



For a complete list of supported IDs and their corresponding definition strings, see:

[Projected Coordinate Systems Listing](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Projected_coordinate_systems/02r3000000vt000000/)

[Geographic Coordinate Systems Listing](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Geographic_coordinate_systems/02r300000105000000/)

[Vertical Coordinate Systems Listing](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/rest/apiref/vcs.html)



Additional information regarding how web scenes work with geometry and spatial reference can be found on the Resource Center:

[ArcGIS Server REST API Geometry object](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/rest/apiref/geometry.html)

[Using spatial references](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Using_spatial_references/02r3000000qq000000/)

[Working with Geometry Objects](http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Geometry_Objects/02r3000000n1000000/)

point_geometry_schema.json.title: pointGeometry
point_geometry_schema.json.description: Defines the JSON formats of the point and spatial reference objects.

m.description: M coordinate which contains measures used for linear referencing.

spatialReference.description: The spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT).

x.description: X coordinate which is measured along the east/west axis.

y.description: Y coordinate which is measured along the north/south axis.

z.description: Z coordinate which measures height or elevation.

polygon_geometry_schema.json.title: polygonGeometry
polygon_geometry_schema.json.description: A polygon contains an array of rings and a spatial reference.

hasM.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains M coordinate values.

hasZ.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains Z coordinate values.

rings.description: Represents an array of rings. Each ring is an array of points.

spatialReference.description: The spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT).

polyline_geometry_schema.json.title: polylineGeometry
polyline_geometry_schema.json.description: Contains an array of paths and a spatialReference.

hasM.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains M coordinate values.

hasZ.description: Indicates whether the geometry contains Z coordinate values.

paths.description: Three nested array levels describing a polyline. The first level describes individual paths; the second describes the points of these paths; and the third gives the coordinates of the points.

spatialReference.description: The spatial reference can be defined using a well-known ID (WKID) or well-known text (WKT).

symbol3D_schema.json.title: Symbol3D
symbol3D_schema.json.description: Symbol3D is the base class for all 3D symbols. It is used to render 2D Point, Polyline, and Polygon features in a FeatureLayer and 3D mesh features in a SceneLayer. All 3D symbols must be used in a SceneView instance; there is no support for 3D rendering in MapViews.

lineSymbol3D_schema.json.title: LineSymbol3D
lineSymbol3D_schema.json.description: LineSymbol3D is used to render features with Polyline geometry in a 3D SceneView.

symbolLayers.description: A Collection of Symbol3DLayer objects used to visualize the graphic or feature.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

styleOrigin_schema.json.title: styleOrigin
styleOrigin_schema.json.description: The origin of the style from which the symbol was originally referenced. A reference to the style origin can be either by styleName or by styleUrl (but not both). It may be used to understand where a symbol was originally sourced from, but does not affect actual appearance or rendering of the symbol.

name.description: Identifies a symbol in the style by name.

styleName.description: A registered web style name, such as `EsriThematicShapesStyle`

lineSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.title: LineSymbol3DLayer
lineSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.description: LineSymbol3DLayer renders Polyline geometries using a flat 2D line with a LineSymbol3D in a 3D SceneView.

size.description: Line width in points, positive only

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

material_schema.json.title: Material
material_schema.json.description: The material used to shade the geometry.

colorMixMode.description:
Controls how symbolLayer or visualVariable color is applied onto the underlying geometry color/texture. This property only applies to FillSymbol3DLayer within MeshSymbol3D.
  • `tint`: the feature's appearance (in terms of color) should be altered to match the symbol / visual variable color.
  • `replace`: the feature's color is replaced with the symbol / visual variable color.
  • `multiply`: the feature's color is multiplied with the symbol color.

color_schema.json.title: color
color_schema.json.description: Color is represented as a three or four-element array. The four elements represent values for red, green, blue, and alpha in that order. Values range from 0 through 255. If color is undefined for a symbol, the color value is null.

pathSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.title: PathSymbol3DLayer
pathSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.description: PathSymbol3DLayer renders Polyline geometries using a volumetric 3D tube with a LineSymbol3D in a SceneView.

size.description: Path size (diameter) in meters, positive only

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

meshSymbol3D_schema.json.title: MeshSymbol3D
meshSymbol3D_schema.json.description: MeshSymbol3D is used to render 3D mesh features in a SceneLayer in a 3D SceneView.

symbolLayers.description: A Collection of Symbol3DLayer objects used to visualize the graphic or feature.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used

fillSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.title: FillSymbol3DLayer
fillSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.description: FillSymbol3DLayer is used to render the surfaces of flat 2D Polygon geometries and 3D volumetric meshes in a SceneView.

edges.description: Specifies an edge visualization style. Only affects MeshSymbol3D.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

edges_schema.json.title: Edges
edges_schema.json.description: Edges describe additional styles applied to visually important edges of 3D objects.

sketchEdges_schema.json.title: Sketch Edges
sketchEdges_schema.json.description: The sketch edge rendering configuration of a symbol layer. Edges of type `sketch` are rendered with a hand-drawn look in mind.

extensionLength.description: A size in points by which to extend edges beyond their original end points.

size.description: Edge size in points, positive only

transparency.description: The value has to lie between `100` (full transparency) and `0` (full opacity).

solidEdges_schema.json.title: Solid Edges
solidEdges_schema.json.description: The solid edge rendering configuration of a symbol layer. Edges of type `solid` are rendered in a single color, unaffected by scene lighting.

extensionLength.description: A size in points by which to extend edges beyond their original end points.

size.description: Edge size in points, positive only

transparency.description: The value has to lie between `100` (full transparency) and `0` (full opacity).

outline_schema.json.title: Outline
outline_schema.json.description: The outline of the symbol layer.

size.description: Outline size in points, positive only

transparency.description: The value has to lie between `100` (full transparency) and `0` (full opacity).

pointSymbol3D_schema.json.title: PointSymbol3D
pointSymbol3D_schema.json.description: PointSymbol3D is used to render features with Point geometry in a 3D SceneView.

symbolLayers.description: A Collection of Symbol3DLayer objects used to visualize the graphic or feature.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used

examples.title: Icon Point Symbol with verticalOffset and leader line callout

size.description: The width of the line in points.

transparency.description: A value between `100` (full transparency) and `0` (full opacity).

type.description: The type of the callout. A callout of type `line` connects an offset symbol or label with its location.

border_schema.json.title: border
border_schema.json.description: Optional border on the line that is used to improve the contrast of the line color against various background colors.

transparency.description: A value between `100` (full transparency) and `0` (full opacity).

iconSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.title: IconSymbol3DLayer
iconSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.description: IconSymbol3DLayer is used to render Point geometries using a flat 2D icon (e.g. a circle) with a PointSymbol3D in a SceneView.

size.description: Icon size in points, positive only

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

iconSymbol3DLayer_resource_schema.json.title: IconSymbol3DLayer Resource
iconSymbol3DLayer_resource_schema.json.description: The shape (primitive) or image URL (href) used to visualize the features.

dataURI.description: an image encoded as base64 string, starting with `data:image/`

primitive.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

objectSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.title: ObjectSymbol3DLayer
objectSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.description: ObjectSymbol3DLayer is used to render Point geometries using a volumetric 3D shape (e.g., a sphere or cylinder) with a Symbol3D in a SceneView.

anchor.description: The positioning of the object relative to the geometry.

depth.description: Object depth in meters, positive only

heading.description: Rotation angle around Z axis in degrees. At 0 degrees, the model points in the direction of the Y-axis. Positive values indicate clockwise rotation (when looked at from the top). [Detailed description](static/objectSymbolLayerOrientation.md).

height.description: Object height in meters, positive only

roll.description: Rotation angle around Y axis in degrees. At 0 degrees, the model is level. A positive value lifts the left part and lowers the right part of the model. [Detailed description](static/objectSymbolLayerOrientation.md).

tilt.description: Rotation angle around X axis in degrees. At 0 degrees, the model is level. A positive value lifts the front and lowers the back of the model. [Detailed description](static/objectSymbolLayerOrientation.md).

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

width.description: Object width in meters, positive only

esriDocumentation.additionalInformation: [Anchor and `origin`](https://developers.arcgis.com/javascript/latest/api-reference/esri-symbols-ObjectSymbol3DLayer.html#anchor) in ArcGIS API for JavaScript.

objectSymbol3DLayer_resource_schema.json.title: ObjectSymbol3DLayer Resource
objectSymbol3DLayer_resource_schema.json.description: The primitive shape (primitive) or external 3D model (href) used to visualize the points.

verticalOffset_schema.json.title: verticalOffset
verticalOffset_schema.json.description: Shifts the symbol along the vertical world axis by a given length. The length is set in screen space units.

maxWorldLength.description: The maximum vertical symbol lift in world units. It acts as an upper bound to avoid lift becoming too big.

minWorldLength.description: The minimum vertical symbol lift in world units. It acts as a lower bound to avoid lift becoming too small.

screenLength.description: Maximal screen length of lift in points.

polygonSymbol3D_schema.json.title: PolygonSymbol3D
polygonSymbol3D_schema.json.description: PolygonSymbol3D is used to render features with Polygon geometry in a 3D SceneView. Polygon features may also be rendered as points with icons or objects at the centroid of each polygon.

symbolLayers.description: A Collection of Symbol3DLayer objects used to visualize the graphic or feature.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

extrudeSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.title: ExtrudeSymbol3DLayer
extrudeSymbol3DLayer_schema.json.description: ExtrudeSymbol3DLayer is used to render Polygon geometries by extruding them upward from the ground, creating a 3D volumetric object.

type.description: Specifies the type of symbol used.

styleSymbolReference_schema.json.title: StyleSymbolReference
styleSymbolReference_schema.json.description: The StyleSymbolReference is used to reference a symbol from a portal styleItem

name.description: Identifies a symbol in the style by name.

styleName.description: A registered web style name, such as `EsriThematicTreesStyle`
